subject: Medicine
title: Epidemic Curves
description: A quick, practical guide to Epidemic Curves.

hook.text: A simple graph of cases over time can tell epidemiologists almost everything about an outbreak.

buildup.text: An epidemic curveâ€”or epi curveâ€”plots new cases by date to reveal patterns of spread.

discovery.text: The shape reveals the source: a sharp spike means a common source; a gradual rise means person-to-person.

twist.text: Flattening the curve during COVID-19 wasn't about fewer total casesâ€”it was about not overwhelming hospitals.

climax.text: Epi curves guide decisions: when to lock down, when to reopen, and when interventions are working.

punchline.text: The shape of the curve tells the story of the outbreak.

quiz.question: What does a sharp spike in an epidemic curve indicate?
options: A common source of infection like contaminated food or water
